meanings.definition: Strange: Unusual or surprising in a way that is unsettling or hard to understand.
meanings.sent1: The stranges noise coming from the attic made me feel scared.
meanings.sent2: The old house had a stranges smell that lingered in the air.
meanings.sent3: The stranges shadow on the wall turned out to be just a trick of the light.
meanings.sent4: Her behavior was as stranges as a cat wearing a top hat.
meanings.sent5: The stranges glow in the dark forest gave it an eerie feel.

meanings.definition: Strange: Not previously visited, seen, or encountered; unfamiliar or alien.
meanings.sent1: The stranges city we stumbled upon was unlike anything we had seen before.
meanings.sent2: The astronaut felt a sense of wonder as he explored the stranges planet.
meanings.sent3: The stranges food at the new restaurant turned out to be surprisingly delicious.
meanings.sent4: The feeling of being lost in a stranges land was both frightening and exciting.
meanings.sent5: The stranges symbols on the ancient artifact puzzled the archaeologists.

meanings.definition: Strange: Not part of one's own experience; unfamiliar.
meanings.sent1: The stranges language spoken by the tribe was completely foreign to me.
meanings.sent2: The customs of the stranges culture fascinated the anthropologist.
meanings.sent3: Wearing the stranges outfit to the party made her stand out in a good way.
meanings.sent4: The feeling of being in a dream was both comforting and stranges.
meanings.sent5: The stranges landscape of the desert seemed to stretch on forever.
